paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy with neuropathic pain.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with FAP at age 52 after presenting with neuropathic pain.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy with cardiac involvement.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 showed cardiac symptoms at age 59.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 62.

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is known to destabilize the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of FAP.
variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population, higher frequency in specific familial cohorts.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies linking V30M to FAP.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is the most common amyloidogenic form in the pathology.
key_quotes: The V30M TTR variant is the most common amyloidogenic form in the pathology.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with FAP at age 52 after presenting with neuropathic pain.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Familial amyloid cardiomyopathy with heart failure.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 was diagnosed with FAC at age 68.
Patient P5 remains asymptomatic at age 72.

functional_data.summary: The L55P variant significantly alters tetramer stability and increases amyloidogenicity.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of FAC.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on familial segregation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The L55P variant is known to be sensitive to acidic conditions.
key_quotes: The L55P TTR tetramer was revealed to also be very sensitive to acidic conditions.
Patient P4 was diagnosed with FAC at age 68.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
